Verified Resident
2013 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/19/2017
I would recommend this apartment complex to my friends. The staff is very professional and treat me with utmost courtesy. They are always pleasant and willing to listen. I feel as if I am valued as a resident. The grounds are well manicured and grass is always cut. My neighbors are friendly and willing to help if needed. By far the best apartment complex I have lived in in Durham. Also have never waited for maintenance over a day.

Report
Verified Resident
2016 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/15/2017
I have been living here for over a year, and it's the ideal situation for me. It is quiet and safe, and the new renovations are nice. One of the best parts of living here is the current management - Alden and Nicquea in particular are amazing, as are Tim and Michael. (Past management has not been great, but this team is fantastic). They are knowledgeable, approachable, professional, and in my experience, go above and beyond to help. With so many residents, I imagine it would be difficult to take the time to address concerns thoroughly, but they do so, even if it means that they stay after closing. They are always cheerful and seem to know every single resident's name. The gym is very nice - also renovated. There's more than enough parking, and maintenance is always prompt and provides updates as needed. It's also a great location to have pets, dogs in particular.

Verified Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/02/2017
I enjoy living here. The complex is recently renovated with granite countertops and wood-laminate floors in some units. The complex staff is really helpful with solving problems. Problems have arisen in my time here but the complex sends maintenance quickly and problems are usually fixed in a timely manner. Packages are delivered to the office, which is sometimes inconvenient. Biggest downside is noise; you can hear neighbors' steps/voices/cars somewhat frequently. The neighborhood is safe; though decently removed from the rest of Durham.

Report
Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/24/2017
I have lived in the Hamptons since July of this year and while I have experienced a couple of issues, the maintenance team has always been quick to respond. I kept having issues with my toilet stopping up and they replaced it the very next day. Alden, who I think is the property manager is always very responsive by email usually getting back to me within a couple of minutes. The renovations they did are nice and I feel safe when I come home. I'm 24 and sometimes I get home very late on the weekends (after 12 or 1 am) and I have never felt uneasy. I will say the parking issue needs to be re visited because sometimes I will have to park a little distance from my building as there is no parking. We have a sticker policy, but not sure who's enforcing it. Other than the few issues I've had since move in, the apartments are really nice and I love my home.

Report
Resident
2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/16/2017
Sadly I only lived at the Hamptons at RTP for a month and the only reason why I stayed that long was because of one staff member, Alden DeLamarter, who went above and beyond to try to ensure my comfort in my new apartment, but he alone could not keep me there. In that month I encountered entirely too many problems. From the time I moved in I honestly can say that the complex was not completely prepared for my arrival. I personally think that there needs to be a rework in the overall communication between the leasing office and maintenance. I walked into my new apartment while maintenance was still finishing up inside. While I understand that things do happen it would have been nice for someone to inform me as to why things were not done before I arrived, especially when they knew that I was moving in over a month in advance. Upon move out there were service items that I requested that still had not been finished and to reiterate I was there for a month. There was one incident where someone in the maintenance crew accidentally flooded my apartment while installing my washer. He thought that he dried all of the water up, but after a couple days I just kept noticing that water was coming from behind the walls into my bathroom and then into my bedroom closet. My shoes all got soaked and I immediately informed the office and put in an emergency work order. My locks had to be changed because they could not find a working key to get into my apartment and then when I returned the next day from out of town I noticed that they neglected to read the entire work order and did not touch the carpet in my closet at all. I had to go back to the office and talk to them in person just to get it properly taken care of. I also dealt with with pests such as spiders (no big deal), crickets, and roaches. Pest control is part of the rent and I am pretty sure that this pest problem did not pop up the second I moved in. They did eventually send pest control to take care of the issue, but I feel like pest control should be coming out on a set schedule regardless of you requesting them or not, even if they rotated buildings once a month. The final straw for me was after a break in. Since I was on the first floor I was required to have a security system. While the complex is in a nice area, these things can happen anywhere for whatever reason. I was impressed by how quickly the leasing office was able to replace my patio glass, but the disappointment came when I returned home from work and the maintenance crew/leasing office thought it was appropriate to leave my door unlocked. After a break in?! This was not the first time that someone left my door unlocked after servicing my apartment, but the excuse that I was given each time was that no one could find a working copy of my keys; another safety concern of mine because had there been some sort of emergency they basically reassured me that they would not be able to get into my apartment. While I think that the employees were all very nice and the amenities were awesome, I felt like my peace of mind was more important and I had to go.

Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/29/2017
I moved into this complex a couple of months ago and I have nothing but positive things to say! Everyone in the office has been very helpful and are always willing to help with any issues/questions... and they're always smiling and seem actually happy to help. The valet trash is a great service and the waste is always gone from by my door in a timely manner. I also really like that they keep packages in the office, so I don't have to worry about having something sit by my door all day while I'm working. So far it has been very quiet and the residents I have come in contact with have all been nice and courteous. Dog park is a perk as well! Like I said, nothing bad to say!

2016 - 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/28/2017
I suspect there are drug dealers, addicts, and parolees that live on these premises. There's a white woman, who clearly is or was a meth addict. I once saw a parole officer checking in on a parolee. The parking needs to be divided by guests and residents, since there are too many guests parking, leaving little to no spaces to park. There should be a sticker system or a space allotted to their guests. I have lots of security concerns here, and will be moving once my lease ends. This should be a gated community, with a police officer in front of the complex.

Resident
2016 - 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 03/04/2017
Don't waste your money on this property. Even though they say that you're renting a fully furnished apartment with cable and utilities included it's not the case. I lived there for 3 months while my husband was getting a double lung transplant.11-1-16 to 1-31-2017. I was paying nearly $2500 a month. The rent was $1500 and the rest was for furnishings, cable and utilities. I got a bill after moving out saying I owed for utilities. I was told I would be getting my $500 deposit back they but kept some of it to pay for the utilities. During my stay, I had to deal with multiple water leaks in both bathrooms at the same time. Cut out walls and ceilings, bleach and plaster smells. Contractors coming in and making a mess and not cleaning up they're messes properly. Leaving plaster on floors, tubs, shower curtains, sinks. Shoe prints! You name it. There wasn't a gym to work out at. If you wanted to you had to go to another complex. Which was inconvenient. Lighting is so dim in the apartment because the light bulbs are very low wattage. I thought that J.R and Eddie from maintenance were very nice and so was Angela.

Resident
2015 - 2016 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/31/2016
Do not waste your time on this POS apartment complex. So many issues, I don't even know where to begin. Let's start with the moldy, nasty apartments that are priced as luxury, but are actually anything but. Their "renovations" they are doing don't touch the mold that has been growing for years (in the walls, bathroom, sink, toilet). And the best part is they are trying to raise their prices because of these "renovations"; about $500 more/month! I was essentially forced to move out due to these renovations and decided moved down the road to an actual luxury apartment complex that is nicer, more spacious, and 1 year old. It is a 2 bedroom apartment for less than the price they wanted to charge for a renovated 1 bedroom. What a scam! As for forcing me to move out, they put a letter under my door saying I have must re-locate. I also must give a 30 day notice if I am going to stay in the apartment complex, just move to another apartment, or move out completely. Their communication was TERRIBLE! I told them I might be interested in a 2 bedroom, but they didn't have any available; they would let me know when they did. I eventually went to the office and told them I'm not interested in staying, and I have found a new home. And that's when crap hit the fan. At this point, they wanted to charge me for 2 months extra, plus $200 for not moving out by the date they had specified (even though my apartment was empty and I had a walk through with the facility manager). When I pulled the lawyer card, they got very defensive and stopped answering my calls and voicemails. I eventually gave a letter on my move out date to Terry Greene with an enclosed check and expected a response; shocker-nothing. I contacted him a month later at which point he demanded ANOTHER $700 from me within 5 business days. I'm telling you, don't touch this place with a 10-foot pole. When I bugged him for my security deposit, it took just about 2 months from my move out to get a security deposit back (which they took $40 out of without an explanation). The lack of communication, unprofessionalism, and scamming of their residents is how they make their money. I am writing to try to save people from this frustration, and letting everyone I know the same. The Hamptons at RTP are TERRIBLE!!

2015 - 2016 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/07/2016
As a federal government employee whose job and moral duty is to protect human health, I am obligated to warn you that your health would potentially be at risk if you rent here. I am moving out due to the fact that they refused to fix the non-functional A/C unit in my apartment despite several attempts at contacting maintenance and management about the problem. I've been waiting for about a month for them to fix it-it's over 80 degrees inside my apartment. They have 25+ year old A/C units in all these apartments and they will NOT fix them for you if yours breaks down. They apparently aren't aware (or don't give a damn) that people actually die in the conditions they left me in. Furthermore, most appliances have broken down in my apartment since I started living here: the stove coil burnt out and caught fire, the bathroom fan died, the refrigerator leaks, the bathroom sink stopper is non-functional, there are insect problems, they never replace your A/C filter, etc. It seems they put more time and effort into external landscaping than they do on internal apartment maintenance and upkeep. Suffice it to say they don't care about their residents or our health and safety. There are much better apartment options in the RTP area at the same price point with newer appliances that have reliable and efficient maintenance staff that can do their jobs. Beware of this mediocre place and their incompetent staff-you deserve better.

Resident
2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/24/2016
Finally, we have moved in and settled down in the Hamptons at RTP, the apartment is lovely and the furniture looks great. I want to take time and say a very big thank you to one of your staff member Ms Penny Suitt for helping me through this process. I needed a short term rental for my son who has internship in the area. It turned out to be a very daunting process from the other companies that I contacted. You might think "she is just renting an apartment, what is the big deal?" Well, let me start by saying that I am from Dallastown, Pennsylvania and I have never ever used an internet process to rent an apartment before. Also I did not have the luxury of coming into the office to fill out a lease form being that I am 8hrs drive away. My search led me to Creekstone at RTP, I filled out an application form and paid the required fee of $200. I made a mistake on the form/I did not fill it right and the application was pending for a while. When I contacted their office, I only had but a couple of phone calls and one e mail about it. To resolve it, I was asked get another e mail (since applications are identified by e mail), fill out another application form and make another payment and then they will cancel and refund the other $200. No one from there bothered to educate me or explain the form to me. And no one explained why that application was forever pending. I decided to walk away from that apartment and my $200 because they did not help me. In the mist of my frustration, I looked at other rental properties in the area and found The Hamptons at RTP. I filled out an application form, paid the required fee and made the same mistake on the form. That mistake turned out to be inclusion of 3 adult names for a one bedroom apt - mom, dad ((guarantors) and son). This application too was pending and the frustration was mounting at this time as I pondered on possible reasons. When I got in touch with the office, Ms Penny Suitt took the call and I explained my plight to her. She promised to look at it, figure out what went wrong and call me back. I thought she would not follow through like the other apartment. Not only did she call me back, she found the reason my application did not go through and she explained to me how she would involve corporate office to have this resolved. She did just that and explained the process to me whenever she got the chance. She was simply amazing!! We got a rental apartment here because of Ms Suitt's help and efforts. Good team effort here. Since I moved in, the few complaints that I made were resolved in no time. I am very pleased to be here at Hamptons apartment. Thanks Penny. Much appreciation

Oh oh oh my heart hearts thinking about this ??. My husband and I love the Hamptons oh so much . It has been nothing less than a remarkable experience here . The grounds are remarkable , well manicured, clean and just perfect . The apartments are in great condition for the year the complex was built . The only thing I don't like is the floors creak a lot so I can hear my neighbor walking a lot . I'm happy the complex is taking on such a large assignment to do renovations ect. The renovations look gorgeous and I have had to think long and hard about this . With the renovations for our little 842sq ft apartment the price is just too outrageous . With much contemplation I decided on a two bedroom in brier creek with same amenities for roughly the same price . Sadly , in looking around many neighboring communities are getting the Hamptons tenants as new tenants or at least prospective because they are floored by the new pricing . My heart is so heavy in this as I didn't expect to be moving so soon . I fully recommend this property to anyone . Great staff, location , safe you name it . However , price wise you can match, I did in brier creek for a two bedroom two bath .

Report
Resident
2011 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/12/2016
I've lived at The Hamptons for nearly five years and I actually really love it here. When I entered the property for the first time, before I even saw the interior of an apartment, I knew I wanted to live here. The grounds are well manicured, the tenants are quiet and the staff is super friendly, super knowledgeable and super helpful. I have a two bed/two bath unit with a fireplace. I love the bright, sunny rooms and I have tons of storage space. Parking is good and you can be sure to find a spot near your apartment home. The units are non-smoking so all the smokers (and there actually aren't that many anymore) come outside. They are pretty good about not leaving butts all over the place and tenants with pets are good about scooping their dogs' poop. The maintenance staff is okay; They mostly have a quick response and they mostly fix things right the first time. When something doesn't go right, they are apologetic and get busy doing whatever it takes to resolve your issue and make you happy. I don't really have a lot of maintenance issues but with the new owners, the maintenance staff has been entering my apartment and doing work and not leaving any indication that they were there or what work was performed. That should never happen, but it's now the rule rather than the exception. They used to have monthly preventive exterminating and now they don't. There's a problem with moisture--I see a lot of "water bugs"--in my kitchen and bathrooms. The bugs weren't a problem when we had preventive maintenance because the exterminator came once a month. Now, you have to call when you see a bug. That sucks. I don't want to see any bugs! I just started treating the areas myself with some stuff I got from Home Depot. The ONLY reason I'm moving is because, in less than five years, this property had been owned by three different companies. With each new owner comes an exorbitant rent increase (this time about $310/month) with no improvements or upgrades to the living unit. The light and plumbing fixtures are dated, appliances are old, the vinyl flooring is old. The remodeled suite on the complex's webpage looks pretty spiffy, but my unity looks nothing like that. I guess as old tenants move out, they upgrade the suites before new folks move in. Even if they did make the upgrades, I'd be scared to hang around and see how much the rent would skyrocket when the ownership changes hands again. I found a place in the neighborhood (literally right up the street) that is less expensive, almost as spacious and has all the upgraded amenities that I don't have at The Hamptons. Except those huge windows. I am going to miss all that natural light.

I guess as old tenants move out, they upgrade the suites before new folks move in. Even if they did make the upgrades, I'd be scared to hang around and see how much the rent would skyrocket when the ownership changes hands again. I found a place in the neighborhood (literally right up the street) that is less expensive, almost as spacious and has all the upgraded amenities that I don't have at The Hamptons. Except those huge windows. I am going to miss all that natural light. Read less

Pursuant to Page-4, Section 27 of the agreement, several items of the lease were violated by your company and are noted and paraphrased as follows: (1) Section 27. This states that if nobody is in the apartment, such persons may enter at reasonable times. I explicitly said to have someone call me (on the telephone and not by email) to state that someone would be arriving in 30 minutes. This wasn't done, and as a result was not a reasonable time for someone to enter my apartment. (2) Section 27(1). Written notice of the entry is left in a conspicuous place in the apartment immediately after the entry. This wasn't done. (3) Section 27(2). Entry is for various concerns such as making repairs, pest control, or showing the apartment to government inspectors for the limited purpose of determining housing and fire ordinance compliance, etc... Since the apartment complex was being shown to a potential buyer "for the purposes of proving the apartments were as advertised", this section also was not met.

Report
Resident
2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/01/2013
My husband and I have enjoyed our time at the Hamptons RTP. We have been living in the community for 6 months and have been very pleased overall with the experience. Some things to note: we are young professionals and find that many other occupants are as well (working at Duke, UNC, RTP) so it is a safe, educated crowd for the most part. The apartment we live in is very nice, new carpets- freshly painted walls, nice details that make it feel "homey" rather than dated. Whenever we have had issues, management responds almost immediately via a phone call or resident portal. We love the fact that our cable/internet is paid for, that is a nice savings for us. We also enjoy the valet trash pick up, in-unit washer and dryer, and the pool is beautiful and well-taken care of. The gym and clubhouse are also great features, nicer than any we've seen at other rental properties. The location, although in its immediate proximity, isn't really close to anything other than the service road, is within a very reasonable driving distance to the highways, grocery stores, and mall. We have had very little noise issues other than some neighbors with yippy, unattended dogs during the day, which has yet to be a problem at night. Parking for the most part is fine, we usually get a great spot unless we get home too late from work or dinner on a weekend. Management is friendly and accomodating. Our biggest complaint is a roach issue, but not sure if that is a result of living in the south or we were infested at some point prior to us moving in. This was for the most part resolved after we put in a few requests for exterminators and also doing some self-extermination. This is a well-kept, safe, and upscale apartment community I would recommend to friends. Very reasonable rent compared to similar complexes in the area.

Pros: Really clean I have hardwood floors on a ground level apartment(great as I have dogs and a 5 year old) Alarm and panic button in first floor apartment Screened in spacious back deck area Very nice pool area Nice office area/artroom Good lighting(windows) Pet friendly I mean up to 4 pets almost unheard of! (2dogs 2 cats not 4 dogs or 4 cats) Rent seems high but considering this is including trash pickup,alarm,and highspeed internet cable..really worth it My experiences with staff have been pleasurable Maintenance is quick to resolve issues(always been same day for me) Fairly well insulated and my apartment seems to have been recently renovated(not sure of others) Cons: Have had some break ins due to drifters from less than nice apartments near area I believe the wooded area and very large shrubbery to act as a cloak for some of these people to move without notice. Parking can be a pain my husband is in a wheelchair though and have reported people taking handicap spots without placard and it was taken care of via resident portal email and flyers at every apt. My upstairs neighboors (although not apts fault) are -------s simply put they have parties and up to 10 small children running around as late as 1am which in turn leaves my son scared to go to sleep not fun Pickup your packages as soon as possible from office I had a delivery conf. and was unable to pick up that day as I was working late went to retrieve item and was told there was no record of it being delivered...kind of an oh no ups must have lost it...ok Managment IS nice but seem s a lil snooty sometimes maybe just used to people complaining because they seem a bit defensive until they realize you are not there to rip them a new one. Overall I am very pleased to call The Hamptons my home this is Durham there will be crime and seeing as the human population is vast in personalities you may not always like your nieghboors but this is the world in which we live If you don't want a problem anywhere on this planet move to the moon :) Read less

Report
Resident
2012 - 2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/26/2013
I moved to the Hamptons at RTP site-on-seen, meaning I didn't have a chance to look at the apartment before I moved in. I did however check out other apartments in the area, so I do have a little bit to compare to. I don't normally write reviews but since I relied on reviews to make my ultimate apartment selection I feel compelled to contribute back to the cause and write a critical and comprehensive review of my own. Parking - 4 stars. I guess it depends on which apartment you live but I've always been able to find a parking space relatively close to my apartment. Even though the community isn't gated the area is pretty well-lit and I've never felt in any kind of danger. One star off because it is a NIGHTMARE to take a left out of the complex between the hours of 5-7pm. The morning commute is also somewhat difficult. Noise - 5 stars. I'm pretty sure the walls are filled with sound deadening, or lead, or corpses because I have NEVER heard my neighbors. This is crazy because they own 2 chihuahuas and I'm constantly in the room next to them. Occasionally I'll hear the faint whirring of a washer/dryer but that's IT. This is probably my favorite feature about the apartment. Grounds - 4 stars. Club house is small but nice (lots of flat screens). Pool is only 3.5 feet deep but there are outdoor showers, grills and coolers available for public use. Grounds are maintained by truckfulls of landscapers. I'd say they do a fine job. Safety - 3 stars. I'm probably being a little harsh here because I don't think this is necessarily the Hamptons' fault but there seems to be a break-in every few months. Maybe this is common but it's definitely not something I'm used to. But to be honest I probably wouldn't know about it or even suspect it happens if it weren't for the Hamptons notifying everyone in the community when it happens. They give a brief description of the incident, remarking what floor it was on, whether the resident had their alarm armed, etc. The 3 incidences I've seen all happened on the ground floor, and if the resident's alarm was set it seemed to scare the burglar off. Bottom line if you keep your doors locked and have your alarm set I think you'll be just fine. Construction - 4 stars. Nothing to write home about really. Everything is sufficiently up-to-date. Tall ceilings. Decent HVAC system. Appliances are probably around 10 years old. Ice maker is legit. Maintenance - 4 stars. Always good response times but things aren't always completely fixed. I can deal with a loose sink handle though. Staff - 4 stars. Anjana and Caroline are great. However there was a mixup when I was explained the terms of the lease (via email) and they mistakenly told me water and electricity would be included in my rent - it was not. One star off there. Overall - 4 stars. Considering the price (slightly below average for this area) and what you get (slightly above average compared to the other places) the Hamptons is a solid value. There's still room for improvement, but after living at the here for almost 9 months I can confidently say it was a good decision and I will likely continue to rent here.

Resident
2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/22/2013
I just resigned my lease and am very excited to be living at The Hamptons for another year. The Hamptons offers the best of both worlds; it is close to the Southpoint mall (shopping and dining) but tucked away in a quiet, wooded area with a home-like feel. There is a great mix to the community - many families and young professionals. The grounds are always well kept and the maintenance team is always hard at work. I believe that The Hamptons offers the best value for your money: cable/internet included in rent, washer/dryer in unit, spacious layouts, huge closets and nice patios. The pool and gym are nice amenities as well. I would definitely recommend it here. To put to rest the other issues residents may have had - I have never had an issue with the management team they are always nice, willing to answer your questions and address any concerns. The maintenance team is friendly, quick and efficient - anytime I have a request it is done within the next day or two. While yes, you will come across a few bugs due to being in a wooded area - extermination is included in rent and scheduled at your home 2x per year. If you have a bug concern out of the ordinary just call the office and they will make sure your apartment is taken care within the week. If you are looking for a quality apartment, with a homey feel, in the RTP area don't look any further.

"For more enjoyment and greater efficiency, consumption is being standardized " (THX 1138) "For only $70/month you can enroll for basic cable and internet through Time Warner Cable! Save money and sign up today!" <b>"At the time of renewal, enrollment will be mandatory."</b> (recent property newsletter) What this means is if residents wish to renew their lease, they have to sign up for this "deal." Resident
2009 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/30/2010
I lived at the Hamptons for about a year in a spacious one bedroom and I can say that it was a great experience. I moved out about 3 weeks ago and I miss the place already; I only moved because of relocating for grad school. The staff was always very friendly. On the downside, I did have a few maintenance issues but anytime there was an issue I either called or filled out an online request and it was usually fixed that same day which was great. I had a very noisy neighbor that eventually moved out but that is just a part of apartment living so that wasn't the community's fault. Lastly, I did have a few issues with insects but when I let the office know, they had an exterminator to come and spray. So, as you can see, any time there was an issue it was quickly resolved which is why I loved the Hamptons. If you are deciding between this community and another, definitely go with the Hamptons. In addition to the great experience I had, the location is prime; so close to I-40 and the Southpoint area.

Resident
2009 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/26/2010
Office staff is pleasant, professional. I haven't had many maintenance problems but one issue did require a few trips before fixed. Parking depends on what building you're in, overall there's plenty of parking, but it's unevenly distributed. Some buildings have far more close spaces than others, and so with some buildings, if you come in after 8pm, you'll be parking a few buildings away and the later you come in, the farther you'll be. Most of the outdoor space is well-lit, but not all, it can seem a little creepy if you're alone. There are occasional social gatherings organized or sponsored by management, the pool is kept very clean, the fitness room has a good range of equipment. The community as a whole is quiet and professional, but as always with apartment living, there are those that act like they're living in a house of their own. Grounds are beautiful and well-kept, but some neighbors leave cigarette butts, trash & even bags of dog poo in outdoor common areas such as stairs & just outside hallways. It seems there's always someone ready to spoil the experience for everyone else or expecting someone else to clean up after them. Overall, a good place to live.

Resident
2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/14/2008
I haven't lived here very long, but as with any apartment complex there are pros and cons. Pros: --The grounds are kept clean and landscaping is always beautiful, along with the clubhouse and pool...and the pool is generally quiet which is nice! --The apartments have a nice layout and some of the amenities have been updated (i.e. chrome knobs, garden tub)...also there's crown molding in the living room and dining area. --The balcony is very large and a nice extra. --There's a washer and dryer in every unit! --Tea/water/coffee (and muffins supposedly) are available every morning in the club house --The community seems safe enough--adequate lighting (recently added street lights that are actually too bright for those living in the units facing the parking lot) and fairly close apartment buildings...also people seem to like to walk around the parking lot for exercise at all hours of the day so you're never really out there by yourself. Cons: --Unless you get a carport at $25 extra a month parking is a free for all, so if you get home after 5:00pm you may have to park fairly far away from your apartment depending on where your apartment is located (so keep this in mind if you're doing grocery shopping after work). --Maintenance is difficult to get in touch with, probably because you have to go through the leasing office to get anything done. They are very quick and efficient once you finally get them though, just stay on top of reminding them if you really care about your maintenance issue. --Noise is not an issue and it's pretty quiet throughout the community but you definitely do hear I-40 noise in the evening if you're towards the back of the community. --As the last person mentioned, painting is not great...there's even a boot mark on the white railing on the balcony from the different shade of paint that was painted on floor of the balcony. The community is very diverse in age and ethnicity. Overall it's comparable to The Lodge at Southpoint in curb appeal, ammenities, and apartment layout, but slightly cheaper and 5 minutes further from the mall

Resident
2007 - 2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/31/2008
I would highly recommend living here. I moved in around 6 months ago and due to some extenuating circumstances I am sadly leaving. Otherwise, I would have stayed as long as I could have. I rented a 2 bedroom apartment which was very spacious. Each bedroom was large enough to put a queen size bed and plenty of other furniture. In the guest bedroom I had an office set up along with a queen size bed with plenty of room to spare. The bathrooms were a good size with garden tubs in each. There was plenty of storage space with the various closets throughout the house. Particularly, the walk-in closets in both bedrooms provided ample space to put anything I needed to store. My apartment had large windows all throughout and on many days it wasn't even necessary to turn a light on in the house. I never had any kind of trouble with the appliances and if there ever were any issues the staff was fairly quick to respond to them. Parking was very convenient and I never once had trouble finding a space that was close to my apartment. The location was very ideal as it was located a few minutes from Southpoint Mall and less than 15 minutes from either Raleigh or Chapel Hill. In addition I would add that the clubhouse and pool area were very nice as was the exercise room. They recently added flat screen tv's in the exercise room which was an added bonus when working out. As far as the staff was concerned, I thought they were awesome. Personally Megan was my favorite but Greyson and Kim were great too. They were the three that I had the most contact with and Megan was the one that initially showed me the apartment. They were always very friendly and treated me with the utmost respect. As far as drawbacks, there were very few to speak of. I lived on the first floor and one day I woke up to find out they were screening in all of the patios. Previously, I was able to pull my grill off of the patio and then pull it back in but after they screened in the area I was no longer able to use it. Also, I had trouble with the sliding doors to the laundry room. I had to have them fixed 3 or 4 times and finally ended up removing them completely. Overall, I would highly recommend this apartment complex to anyone. It was a very peaceful and relaxed community and I never once had any concerns about my safety. If you are looking for a place to move, I don't think there is any way you can go wrong moving here.

Resident
2007 Recommended Property Reviewed 12/03/2007
We've been in our apartment for about 11 months. I'd have to say the place is very good to excellent. Upsides: The apartment itself (a two-bedroom second-floor) is spacious and well-laid out, with a huge wraparound balcony and good fixtures, and seems well-built. The appliances are reliable, and we've had very few maintenance issues. The grounds on our side of the complex aren't stunningly gorgeous--mostly parking lots--but they do try to keep up with what grounds they do have. The location is great, within an easy drive of Southpoint, NC 55, I-40, and RTP, although the main highway in front of the complex (NC 54) backs up like crazy at rush hour and turning left is always an adventure. The pool and pool deck are beautiful. Downsides: Noise is a bit of a problem for us, but I think the folks above us have a couple of kids, so that would explain the thumping and bumping. Other than that, things are pretty quiet. If you end up at the back of the complex (600, 800, or 1000 Aaron), expect to hear noise from trucks out on Interstate 40, which runs maybe 100 yards from the buildings. They could use more lighting in the parking lots, it gets pretty dark out there. This property got sold by Korman to another management group in August, and is back to being called The Hamptons again. There's a whole new staff there, and the jury is still out on their performance. Our 2008 rent, if we signed another 12-month lease, would go up about 3%--not bad considering the market around here. These places are a bit expensive, but worth it. We're hoping to relocate soon, but if we were staying in Durham, we'd stay here.

I have lived here for almost 3 months and have enjoyed the amenities and friendly staff. Prior to moving here for work I spoke with Megan (corp. mgr) on several occasions with various questions. She always had a pleasant patient demeanor. Packages are accepted by the office staff without problems. The apt is huge and there were even several items such as a welcome packet and sodas in my apartment upon my arrival. For a one bedroom it's much more living space than one person needs but no complaints in that dept. As always in apt living, you hear your neighbors above you. It's tolerable. There seem to be a bunch of young families in this community with a good amount of employees from RTP. Very nerdy but nerds are quite and that's just fine. Love the STARBUCKS and muffins weekdays! Haven't been to the tiny gym or the yoga classes. Pool is nice and not overrun with people. Very accessible to the highways, restaurants, and Southpoint Mall. Why $500 of which only $250 is refundable?! Although the apt is in perfect condition, somehow I think they will FIND away to keep the full amount. Lastly, Management has recently changed and the transition has appeared to be seamless. MW

1999 - 2001 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/10/2003
The Hamptons was built about 6-7 years ago by a company that builds them, makes them profitable and then sells them a year later. It was sold to Korman Communities. We lived here for about 2 1/2 horrible years. <br><br><br><br> <br><br><br><br>This apartment complex was built on a swamp. To see what it looked like before, look at the undeveloped land between it and the Chick-fil-a down the street. We rented a ground unit(Which was a mistake) seeing as how unbeknowingst to us it was bug city. During the summertime, we could thouroughly saturate our porch with a whole can of Raid and yet be inundated with spiders and their webbing 3 weeks later. We never opened any windows and yet had a gnat problem as well as some little microscopic bugs that were crawling in through the window seal. Inside we have found earwigs, 5 inch centipedes and a spider that while crunched up in the corner of the bedroom was still at least 3 inches long. <br><br><br><br> <br><br><br><br>Also there was water spots on the wall which we believe was mold growing in the sheetrock. The last rainy season I spent there had me sick with pneumonia for a whole month. My wife was bitten by a bug on her eye while she slept and was perscribed a steroid to keep her eye from swelling completely shut. This later turned into blepharitis and pink eye. <br><br><br><br> <br><br><br><br>And if insect infestation and health reasons aren´t enough, how about crime. They used to have a police guy that lived there and we organized "1" meeting because someone´s place got broken into. Come to find out it was a section of the complex in which the exterior light had burned out a month ago. After this meeting we had thought that it had cleared up since no others had been called. In inquiring to our neighbors, someone else had been broken into as well. All in all we heard through the grape vine of at least 8-9 apt break-ins and a couple of car break-ins that were shush-shushed by the management. There was even a getaway path through the woods in which criminals from the low income apartment complex next door would come through in order to break in and steal things. Eventually they replaced some of the burnt out outside fixtures. I think this is when Larry Korman came down to visit and they were trying to impress him. <br><br><br><br> <br><br><br><br>Our neighbors upstairs had either a small child or a dog that would run all the time. so strong was it that it knocked the plastic piece from the fire extinguisher head in the kitchen. <br><br><br><br> <br><br><br><br>We asked to transfer to another unit and it was rented out from under us because we requested to see it before we committed to it. Jeebus, who could blame us since we were living in an animal kingdom sickhouse. We then went elsewhere and the Hamptons refused to give any comment other than they have not requested a move-out date(Our lease was up in 2 months). We finally found a place nearby where we got in, no thanks to the Hamptons, and had to threaten litigation before they let us end our lease a month early after we had lived there for 2 years. We got called "Bad People" from the apartment manager who is also the regional manager, Kathy, because we wanted to live in a place where it was not bad for our health.

Pets

  • Cats Allowed
    Fee: $300 ~ 450
    Rent: $40
    Restrictions: We are proud to be a pet-friendly community, and we hope you and your pet will find a happy home at our community. We welcome 2 pets per apartment home. There is a pet fee of $300 for the first pet and $150 for the second pet. Pet rent is $20 per month per pet. The following aggressive breeds are prohibited: Staffordshire Bull Terrier (Pit Bull), Doberman, Akita, Chow, Presa Canario, German Shepherd, Rottweiler, and any mix of these breeds. Please call our leasing office for complete pet policy.
    Pet Limit: 2

Leasing

The Hamptons at Research Triangle Park ensures an ambiance of refinement and relaxation. Perfectly situated on Highway 54, one mile west of Research Triangle Park, The Hamptons offers easy access to Raleigh-Durham Regional Airport, Duke University, UNC and downtown Durham. It is close to retail shops, movie theaters, and many fine restaurants. The finest of interior amenities and our selection of eight generous floor plans await you. Explore living beyond the ordinary.

Management Company: Cortland Partners*
